Survivor Journey

Amie Corr: The Day I Was Diagnosed

THE FIRST DAY I GOT DIAGNOSED WITH BREAST CANCER I pretended like everything was fine because everyone said, “We are with you and you'll be fine.” But why did I wake up at 3 a.m, alone, crying and feeling unimaginable pain? I had to smile and pretend I was strong the next morning because I didn't want pity. As the days went by, I started to feel disconnected from the world—because how do I explain to someone that my body no longer feels or looks the same without being pitied? To be continued whenever I feel like talking again.
